element.display: This template is recommended for reporting biopsy specimens, but is not required for accreditation purposes.

target.code: 399687005 |Anatomic location of primary malignant neoplasm (observable entity)|

element.display: Skin of other and unspecified parts of face
Skin of upper limb and shoulder
Skin of lower limb and hip
Please complete a separate checklist for each primary site
Melanoma in situ, superficial spreading type (low-cumulative sun damage (CSD) melanoma in situ)
Melanoma in situ, lentigo maligna type
Melanoma in situ arising in a giant congenital nevus
Melanoma in situ, not otherwise classified
# Margin involvement by melanoma in situ should be recorded if in situ disease is present in the specimen, and if margins are uninvolved by invasive melanoma.
?Not applicable (in situ disease is absent and margins are uninvolved by invasive carcinoma)
All margins negative for melanoma in situ
Closest Peripheral Margin Location(s) to Melanoma in situ
Distance from Melanoma in Situ to Peripheral Margin
Melanoma in situ present at margin
Margin(s) Involved by Melanoma in Situ

Reporting of pT categories is based on information available to the pathologist at the time the report is issued. As per the AJCC (Chapter 1, 8th Ed.) it is the managing physician’s responsibility to establish the final pathologic stage based upon all pertinent information, including but potentially not limited to this pathology report.
pT0: No evidence of primary tumor (e.g., unknown primary or completely regressed melanoma)
pTis: Melanoma in situ (i.e., not an invasive tumor: anatomic level I)
Superficial spreading melanoma (low-cumulative sun damage (CSD) melanoma)
Melanoma arising in a blue nevus (blue nevus-like melanoma)
Melanoma arising in a giant congenital nevus
II (melanoma present in but does not fill and expand papillary dermis)
III (melanoma fills and expands papillary dermis)
Specify number of mitoses per mm2
All margins negative for invasive melanoma
Distance from Invasive Melanoma to Closest Peripheral Margin
Distance from Invasive Melanoma to Deep Margin
# Margin involvement by melanoma in situ should be recorded if in situ disease is present in the specimen, and if margins are uninvolved by invasive melanoma.
?Not applicable (in situ disease is absent and margins are uninvolved by invasive carcinoma)
All margins negative for melanoma in situ
Distance from Melanoma in Situ to Closest Peripheral Margin
Distance from Melanoma in Situ to Deep Margin
Melanoma in situ present at margin
Margin(s) Involved by Melanoma in Situ

Reporting of pT categories is based on information available to the pathologist at the time the report is issued. As per the AJCC (Chapter 1, 8th Ed.) it is the managing physician’s responsibility to establish the final pathologic stage based upon all pertinent information, including but potentially not limited to this pathology report.
pT not assigned (cannot be determined based on available pathological information)
pT0: No evidence of primary tumor (e.g., unknown primary or completely regressed melanoma)
pT1: Melanoma 1.0 mm or less in thickness, ulceration status unknown or unspecified (see Note D)
pT1a: Melanoma less than 0.8 mm in thickness, no ulceration
pT1b: Melanoma less than 0.8 mm in thickness with ulceration; or Melanoma 0.8 to 1.0 mm in thickness with or without ulceration
pT2: Melanoma greater than 1.0 to 2.0 mm in thickness, ulceration status unknown or unspecified
pT2a: Melanoma greater than 1.0 to 2.0 mm in thickness, no ulceration
pT2b: Melanoma greater than 1.0 to 2.0 mm in thickness, with ulceration
pT3: Melanoma greater than 2.0 to 4.0 mm in thickness, ulceration status unknown or unspecified
pT3a: Melanoma greater than 2.0 to 4.0 mm in thickness, no ulceration
pT3b: Melanoma greater than 2.0 to 4.0 mm in thickness, with ulceration
pT4: Melanoma greater than 4.0 mm in thickness, ulceration status unknown or unspecified
pT4a: Melanoma greater than 4.0 mm in thickness, no ulceration
pT4b: Melanoma greater than 4.0 mm in thickness, with ulceration
For molecular genetic reporting, the CAP Melanoma Biomarker Template should be used. Pending biomarker studies should be listed in the Comments section of this report.
